newsitem.title: HONG KONG: RESEARCH ALERT--HK banks to see rates rise benefit.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT--HK banks to see rates rise benefit.

text.p: The profitability of Hong Kong banks is likely to benefit from higher interest rates in 1997, reflecting falling real interest rates and higher free funds contribution, Salomon Brothers said in a recent report.
The brokerage said it did not see any negative impact on loan growth prospects for Hong Kong's banking sector even if rates were increased by 50 basis points in March.

"We believe that modestly higher interest rates would produce a positive impact on Hong Kong banks' net interest margins as a result of increased 'free funds' contribution, despite a temporary squeeze in the price/HIBOR spread," it said.
Salomon also said it suspected there were modest near-term downside risks for Hong Kong bank stocks, in view of the impending tightening in U.S. monetary policy.
"But any sell-off should be nowhere near as dramatic as that experienced in 1994," it added.

The brokerage said it considered any further sell-off as presenting a compelling buying opportunity, particularly in the shares of Dah Sing Financial Holdings Ltd, FPB Bank Holdings Co Ltd, Hang Seng Bank Ltd, Wing Hang Bank Ltd and HSBC Holdings Plc.
